page.title: 07WEDGWOOD FACTORY, BARLASTON
page.content: Throwing is the first stage to making pottery. They throw the clay onto an elecrically operated wheel. The clay they use is either Jasper or Basalt, but sometimes they use Bone China. It takes 7 years to train to be a thrower. Turning is the second stage of making pottery. A turner puts a rough clay shape on a turning machine and with a chisel he will shape it to the proper shape and size. The surplus clay is recycled. It takes 7 years to train to be a turner. Figure making is the next stage of making pottery. The slip is poured into a detailed mould, and is then eased gently out with an instrument and the imprints are shown very clearly. It takes 6 months basic training to be a figure maker. Nearly all the figure makers are women.
